FYI for reviewers, there are some new changes:

  • Clang doesn't support -fpermissive, so I had to insert static_cast as necessary. Mercifully there weren't too many of these needed
  • GCC 7.2 doesn't support #include "stdatomic.h" from C++. So I had to port THAtomic.h to <atomic>. This was pretty straightforward, and I doublechecked my work. Added std::atomic<> to a number of important sites.

I still haven't figured out why Windows hates me.

body:
FYI for reviewers, there are some new changes:

- Clang doesn't support `-fpermissive`, so I had to insert `static_cast` as necessary. Mercifully there weren't too many of these needed
- GCC 7.2 doesn't support `#include "stdatomic.h"` from C++. So I had to port THAtomic.h to `<atomic>`. This was pretty straightforward, and I doublechecked my work. Added `std::atomic<>` to a number of important sites.

I still haven't figured out why Windows hates me.
